title: Steak tartare

ingredients.content: 500 g beef sirloin, cut into cubes (approx. 4 x 4 cm)
250 g spring onions, cut into halves (approx. 3 stalks)

preparations.content: Place meat in a single layer on a tray and keep in freezer for 20-30 minutes.
Place spring onions in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Remove from mixing bowl and set aside in a bowl.
Place gherkins in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Remove from mixing bowl and set aside in another bowl.
Place hard boiled eggs in mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 4<b>.Remove from mixing bowl and set aside in another bowl.
Chop onion, parsley, chervil and tarragon <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Remove from mixing bowl and set aside in a large bowl.
Place half of semi-frozen meat in mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>-10, increasing speed gradually<b>. Remove from mixing bowl and set aside in bowl with onion and herbs.
Place remaining semi-frozen meat in mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>-10, increasing speed gradually<b>. Remove from mixing bowl and set aside in same bowl.

Add lemon juice, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, capers, salt and pepper to bowl and mix with spatula. Divide meat into 6 portions and form steak tartare (you can do so with the help of a ring mould). Serve steak tartare with spring onions, gherkins and chopped boiled eggs .
